data.title: TASTES WEIRD
data.text: Had the chocolate and the coffee oreo. It had a very strange taste. The chocolate tasted as if it had cinnamon in it, and kind of tasted like a fudgsicle. The coffee also tasted kind of odd, as if it was kind of like a coffee flavoring. Also, there weren't any big chunks of oreo. And the texture of the ice cream wasn't really heavy and thick, like it had some air in it. It was strange ice cream.

data.title: Homemade ice cream in Gilman Square !!
data.text: We feel SO lucky to live near this shop! We walk here frequently and the flavors are amazing, the counter help friendly and we hope that they can afford to stay for a very long time. We LOVE Tipping Cow and will likely be as big as cows soon, thanks to their wonderful ice cream !

data.title: Rich, home-made ice cream
data.text:
The easiest way to check ice cream quality is to eat the vanilla ice cream. I had this with chocolate sprinkles (they should call them jimmies). Anyway, it was excellent. My wife had the caramel bourbon with a sugar cookie. I will try the chocolate next time.

The only drawback is that parking is very difficult. Parking is allowed on Medford St (not easy) and requires a local permit on the side streets.

data.title: Best chocolate ice cream I've ever had
data.text: The salt dark chocolate ice cream is rich and flavourful and just incredible. But it's not the only amazing ice cream they have. They are incredible creative and successful with all their creations. The strawberry basil one is also one of my favourites!

data.title: That's Some Great Homemade  Ice Cream!
data.text: We stopped at this new scoop shop last weekt for dessert.  So glad we did!  I had the Key Lime Pie which was WONDERFUL and the Strawberry Shortcake YUMMY.  Had lots of other small tastings as well.... The Buttermilk Vanilla was smooth and creamy.... Dark Chocolate Sea Salt is great and the Espresso Chip was yummy but would keep me awake all night so maybe another afteroon I'll do do that one. I picked up a couple of pints to bring home - Strawberry Basil was one.  It should be interesting!  Looking forward to my next visit.
